snippet: Many in a nation still recovering from a nuclear disaster said that the guidelines — in line with standards in the United States — were too strict.
abstract: Proposed new safety guidelines for Japan’s nuclear industry--strict enough that they could keep reactors shuttered for years for emergency upgrades--have set off intense political maneuvering by those who say regulations will cripple business just as hopes were rising for economic relief.
lead_paragraph: Many in a nation still recovering from a nuclear disaster said that the guidelines — in line with standards in the United States — were too strict.

headline.seo: Proposed Rules for Japan’s Nuclear Industry Called Too Strict
headline.main: Critics Say Proposed Guidelines for Japan’s Nuclear Industry Will Hinder Business
headline.print_headline: Critics Say Proposed Guidelines for Japan’s Nuclear Industry Will Hinder Business
